intro: Jobinia longicoronata, commonly known as the long-crowned jobinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a tall, erect stem with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is the showy, yellow-to-orange flower head, which consists of numerous small florets arranged in a radiate pattern. Jobinia longicoronata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
